title: Add Call Now and WhatsApp buttons to Contact section

requirements.summary: Add prominent Call Now and WhatsApp buttons in the Contact section (id "contact") using phone number 9080250925 with correct tel and wa.me links.
acceptanceCriteria: The Contact section displays two clearly labeled buttons: "Call Now" and "WhatsApp".
"Call Now" uses a tel link to 9080250925 (href="tel:9080250925").

"WhatsApp" opens WhatsApp chat for 9080250925 using a wa.me link with the correct country code for India (https://wa.me/919080250925) and opens in a new tab (target="_blank" with rel="noopener noreferrer").
Buttons are visible and usable on both mobile and desktop layouts and do not break the existing inquiry form submission flow.
All user-facing text on the buttons is in English.

file_operations.description: Add a prominent direct-contact button group near the Contact section header and/or near the inquiry form. Use the existing shadcn-ui Button component to render consistent, accessible buttons/links (e.g., as link-styled buttons) for: (1) href="tel:9080250925" labeled "Call Now" and (2) href="https://wa.me/919080250925" labeled "WhatsApp" with target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer". Ensure responsive layout (stack on mobile, inline on desktop) and keep the form submission behavior unchanged. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update Contact section copy to clarify visitors can either submit the inquiry form or contact directly via phone/WhatsApp, without changing other sections.
acceptanceCriteria: The Contact section includes a short English line of helper text near the new buttons (or near the form) indicating direct contact options are available.
No references are added implying inquiries will be delivered to email automatically.

file_operations.description: Revise the Contact section helper text (header paragraph and/or card description) to explicitly mention the two contact options: submit the inquiry form or contact directly by phone/WhatsApp. Keep wording in English, avoid implying automatic email delivery, and avoid changes to other sections. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
